page.title: 18 FAVERSHAM CREEK
page.content: FAVERSHAM CREEK winds for 5 kms from the Swale to the heart of the town but it is no longer the main artery of trade.Costing the town 10,000 pounds p.a.it does gain from the Hatch charity.6,000 pounds was granted for dredging to improve the turning point below Pauls & 2,500 pounds for a new jetty at the town green.Commercial shipping has declined from 40 per month when Shellmex operated until 1970 to approx 1 vessel every 2 months.Silting is a problem.Vessel movements have to be on the highest spring tides but,even then stranding occurs.Faversham's problem is that fewer vessels means more silting and more silting means fewer ships.Many who are closely nvolved with the creek sucH as H.Parter,pilot,G.Gregory,bridge operator and A.Reekie at iron wharf feel that any future will lie with
